Title:
Two new species in Capillidium from China, with proposal of a
new combination
Keywords:
Ancylistaceae  Capilliconidia  Phylogeny  Morphology  New
taxa
Abstract:
Within the taxonomic revision of Conidiobolus s.l.
(Ancylistaceae, Entomophthorales), the genus Capillidium was delimited
to accommodate all members form capilliconidia. In the present study, we
firstly reported two new species of Capillidium from China. Capillidium
macrocapilliconidium sp. nov. is characterised by its larger
capilliconidia compared to other Capillidium species. Capillidium
tianwangense sp. nov. is mostly allied to Ca. denaeosporum, but it
differs from its larger capilliconidia, longer primary conidiophores and
slender secondary conidiophores. Phylogenetic analysis based on the
nuclear large subunit of rDNA (nucLSU), the mitochondrial small subunit
of rDNA (mtSSU) and the translation elongation factor 1-alpha gene
(TEF1) obtained robust support for these two new species. Additionally,
a new combination of Capillidium rugosum (Drechsler) B. Huang & Y.
Nie comb. nov. was proposed. An identification key is provided for the
ten accepted Capillidium species.
